snippet: After landslide re-election wins, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and his father, Gov. Mario M. Cuomo, were accused of failing to support other Democrats on the ballot.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo's re-election harkens back to 1986, when his father, former New York Gov Mario M Cuomo, won re-election; both Cuomos focused on securing landslide victories long before Election Day, stoking chatter about national ambitions, and both angered many on the left.

byline.contributor: Jason Horowitz and Thomas Kaplan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: After landslide re-election wins, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and his father, Gov. Mario M. Cuomo, were accused of failing to support other Democrats on the ballot.

headline.main: Like Father, Like Son: Similarities in Cuomos’ Races for Governor Rankle Democrats
headline.print_headline: Like Father, Like Son: Similarities in Governors’ Races Rankle Democrats
